required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of SYSA1801 in the Treatment of Claudin( CLDN) 18.2 Positive Advanced Malignant Solid Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Trial to Evaluate Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Immunogenicity and Initial Efficacy of SYSA1801 in the Treatment of CLDN 18.2 Positive Advanced Malignant Solid Tumor

lead_sponsor.agency: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, dose escalation, dose expansion and extension cohort phase 1 study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and preliminary anti-tumor activity of SYSA1801

detailed_description.textblock: This study includes two stages. The dose escalation and dose expansion part (Stage I) will determine the MTD and RP2D of SYSA1801 in subjects with advanced solid tumor for which there is no available standard likely to confer clinical benefit based on a modified 3+3 dose escalation design (an accelerated dose titration design followed by traditional 3+3 dose escalation design) The extension cohort (Stage II) will evaluate the preliminary efficacy and safety of SYSA1801 in subjects with Claudin 18.2 positive gastric cancer (GC), gastroesophageal junction (GEJ) cancer, pancreatic cancer, non-small cell lung cancer and other solid tumors who have relapsed and/or are refractory to approved therapies.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 21 days after the first dose of SYSA1801
primary_outcome.description: DLT was defined as ≥grade 3 adverse events (per protocal and NCI CTCAE 5.0)related to the study drug that occurred in the first administration cycle (21 days) of SYSA1801
RP2D may be selected based on the Maximum tolerated dose(MTD), pharmacokinetic and antitumor activity data

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence, severity, and outcome of adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of SYSA1801
primary_outcome.description: The adverse events occurring or worsening on or after the first dose of the study drug will be recorded

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and multiple timepoints up to 21 days after every dose (stage I)
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax of SYSA1801, total antibodies and free MMAE

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and multiple timepoints up to 21 days after every dose (stage I)
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax of SYSA1801, total antibodies and free MMAE

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and multiple timepoints up to 21 days after every dose (stage I)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC of SYSA1801, total antibodies and free MMAE

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and multiple timepoints up to 21 days after every dose (stage I)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibodies against SYSA1801, including neutralizing antibodies
ORR was defined as the proportion of patients achieving either a confirmed complete response or partial response (PR), per RECIST v1.1
DCR is the proportion of patients with disease control (include patients with Complete response, partial response and stable disease)
PFS is defined as the time from the date of first administration to the date of the first documentation of progressive disease or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

arm_group.description: Stage I: Dose Escalation and dose expansion： Dose Escalation：SYSA1801 will be administered intravenously (IV) at different dose levels, including 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4.5 and 6 mg/kg according to a modified 3+3 dose-escalation design. Accelerated dose titration design will be used for the first 2 dose levels (0.5 and 1 mg/kg), and then traditional 3+3 dose escalation design will be used for the following levels (2, 3, 4.5 and 6 mg/kg). Dose expansion: SYSA 1801 will be administered at up to dose levels which is equal or lower than MTD IV infusion. Each dose level contains no more than 12 subjects (including subjects in dose escalation) Stage II: Extension cohort This cohort will comprise subjects with Claudin 18.2 positive GC or GEJ adenocarcinoma, pancreatic cancer or other solid cancer with prior failure of, progression on, or intolerance to, standard therapy. The starting dose of SYSA1801 for expansion will be derived from the RP2D determined during Stage I

intervention.description: SYSA1801 will be administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle. Individual subjects may continue study treatment until there is evidence of disease progression (clinical or radiologic) judged by Investigators, unacceptable toxicity or other reasons for treatment discontinuation.
